description.raw:
Addresses #2541.

It looks like any class that includes `gazebo/gui/gui.hh` will end up needing `QTest` symbols. See a plugin for example:

~~~
developer@2acf1ecf5fc2:~/gazebo$ nm -g /usr/local/lib/gazebo-9/plugins/libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so  | grep QTest
                 U _ZN5QTest15defaultKeyDelayEv@@Qt_5
                 U _ZN5QTest15lastMouseButtonE@@Qt_5
                 U _ZN5QTest17defaultMouseDelayEv@@Qt_5
                 U _ZN5QTest18lastMouseTimestampE@@Qt_5
                 U _ZN5QTest5qWarnEPKcS1_i@@Qt_5
                 U _ZN5QTest6qSleepEi@@Qt_5
~~~

And then if you don't link against QTest libraries, the plugin will fail to run.

I think the long-term solution would be for `QTest` headers to be removed from `gazebo/gui/gui.hh`. But removing them in a release branch may break user code, so I'll make a PR to `default`.

Alternative solutions are to:

1. Link against `${Qt5Test_LIBRARIES}`
1. Don't include `gazebo/gui/gui.hh`

This PR changes all built-in plugins and example plugins to do option 2 and don't include that big header. I'm personally not a fan of these large includes anyway.
